query.prompt:
Please translate each line literally into English.
7 E già la vita di quel lume santo 8 rivolta s’era al Sol che la rïempie 9 come quel ben ch’a ogne cosa è tanto.
query.result: 7 And already the life of that holy light 8 had turned to the Sun that fills it 9 as that good which is to every thing so much.

query.prompt:
Please translate each line literally into English.
10 Ahi anime ingannate e fatture empie, 11 che da sì fatto ben torcete i cuori, 12 drizzando in vanità le vostre tempie!
13 Ed ecco un altro di quelli splendori 14 ver’ me si fece, e ’l suo voler piacermi 15 significava nel chiarir di fori.
query.result:
10 Ah, deceived souls and empty deeds, 11 that from so great good twist the hearts, 12 straightening in vanity your temples!
13 And behold another of those splendors 14 came toward me, and its will to please me 15 signified itself in the clarifying of holes.

query.prompt:
Please translate each line literally into English.
16 Li occhi di Bëatrice, ch’eran fermi 17 sovra me, come pria, di caro assenso 18 al mio disio certificato fermi.
query.result: 16 The eyes of Beatrice, which were fixed 17 over me, as before, with dear consent 18 firmly certified to my desire.

query.prompt:
Please translate each line literally into English.
19 «Deh, metti al mio voler tosto compenso, 20 beato spirto», dissi, «e fammi prova 21 ch’i’ possa in te refletter quel ch’io penso!».
query.result: 19 “Oh, quickly put to my will a recompense, 20 blessed spirit,” I said, “and show me proof 21 that I may in you reflect what I think!”

query.prompt:
Please translate each line literally into English.
22 Onde la luce che m’era ancor nova, 23 del suo profondo, ond’ ella pria cantava, 24 seguette come a cui di ben far giova:
25 «In quella parte de la terra prava 26 italica che siede tra Rïalto 27 e le fontane di Brenta e di Piava,
28 si leva un colle, e non surge molt’ alto, 29 là onde scese già una facella 30 che fece a la contrada un grande assalto.
query.result:
22 Whence the light that was still new to me, 23 from its deepness, from which it previously sang, 24 followed as to one to whom doing good profits:
25 “In that part of the crooked earth 26 Italian that sits between Rialto 27 and the fountains of Brenta and Piava,
28 rises a hill, and it does not surge very high, 29 there where descended already a spark 30 that made upon the neighborhood a great assault.”

query.prompt:
Please translate each line literally into English.
37 Di questa luculenta e cara gioia 38 del nostro cielo che più m’è propinqua, 39 grande fama rimase; e pria che moia,
40 questo centesimo anno ancor s’incinqua: 41 vedi se far si dee l’omo eccellente, 42 sì ch’altra vita la prima relinqua.
query.result:
37 Of this brilliant and dear joy 38 of our heaven that is most near to me, 39 great fame remained; and before she died,
40 this hundredth year still completed itself: 41 see if one must make the man excellent, 42 so that he leaves the first life for another.

query.prompt:
Please translate each line literally into English.
52 Piangerà Feltro ancora la difalta 53 de l’empio suo pastor, che sarà sconcia 54 sì, che per simil non s’entrò in malta.
query.result: 52 Feltro will still weep the fault 53 of its wicked pastor, who will be so foul 54 that for similar, one did not enter Malta.

query.prompt:
Please translate each line literally into English.
55 Troppo sarebbe larga la bigoncia 56 che ricevesse il sangue ferrarese, 57 e stanco chi ’l pesasse a oncia a oncia,
58 che donerà questo prete cortese 59 per mostrarsi di parte; e cotai doni 60 conformi fieno al viver del paese.
query.result:
55 Too large would be the balance 56 that received the Ferrarese blood, 57 and tired he who weighed it ounce by ounce,
58 that this courteous priest will give 59 to show himself partisan; and such gifts 60 are conform to the living of the country.

query.prompt:
Please translate each line literally into English.
61 Sù sono specchi, voi dicete Troni, 62 onde refulge a noi Dio giudicante; 63 sì che questi parlar ne paion buoni».

Please translate each line literally into English.
64 Qui si tacette; e fecemi sembiante 65 che fosse ad altro volta, per la rota 66 in che si mise com’ era davante.
query.result: 64 Here it was silent; and made me appear 65 that it was turned to another time, by the wheel 66 in which it set itself as it was before.

query.prompt:
Please translate each line literally into English.
67 L’altra letizia, che m’era già nota 68 per cara cosa, mi si fece in vista 69 qual fin balasso in che lo sol percuota.
query.result: 67 The other joy, which was already known to me 68 for a dear thing, made itself visible to me 69 like a pale fin where the sun strikes.

query.prompt:
Please translate each line literally into English.
70 Per letiziar là sù fulgor s’acquista, 71 sì come riso qui; ma giù s’abbuia 72 l’ombra di fuor, come la mente è trista.
query.result: 70 For joy up there gains brightness, 71 just as laughter here; but down below darkens 72 the shadow from outside, as the mind is sad.

query.prompt:
Please translate each line literally into English.
73 «Dio vede tutto, e tuo veder s’inluia», 74 diss’ io, «beato spirto, sì che nulla 75 voglia di sé a te puot’ esser fuia.
query.result: 73 “God sees everything, and your seeing is reflected,” 74 I said, “blessed spirit, so that nothing 75 of itself can ever be foreign to you.”

query.prompt:
Please translate each line literally into English.
76 Dunque la voce tua, che ’l ciel trastulla 77 sempre col canto di quei fuochi pii 78 che di sei ali facen la coculla,
79 perché non satisface a’ miei disii? 80 Già non attendere’ io tua dimanda, 81 s’io m’intuassi, come tu t’inmii».
query.result:
76 Therefore your voice, which the heavens disturbs 77 always with the song of those pious fires 78 that with six wings make the cocoon,
79 why does it not satisfy my desires? 80 Already I do not await your question, 81 if I were to understand, as you express yourself.

query.prompt:
Please translate each line literally into English.
82 «La maggior valle in che l’acqua si spanda», 83 incominciaro allor le sue parole, 84 «fuor di quel mar che la terra inghirlanda,
85 tra ’ discordanti liti contra ’l sole 86 tanto sen va, che fa meridïano 87 là dove l’orizzonte pria far suole.
query.result:
82 “The greatest valley in which the water spreads,” 83 began then his words, 84 is outside that sea which encircles the land,
85 between the conflicting shores against the sun 86 goes so far, that it makes midday 87 where the horizon first used to rise.

query.prompt:
Please translate each line literally into English.
88 Di quella valle fu’ io litorano 89 tra Ebro e Macra, che per cammin corto 90 parte lo Genovese dal Toscano.
query.result: 88 Of that valley I was a shore dweller 89 between Ebro and Macra, which by a short path 90 separates the Genoese from the Tuscan.

query.prompt:
Please translate each line literally into English.
91 Ad un occaso quasi e ad un orto 92 Buggea siede e la terra ond’ io fui, 93 che fé del sangue suo già caldo il porto.
query.result: 91 To a sunset almost and to a garden 92 Buggea sits and the land from which I was, 93 that made of its blood already warm the harbor.

query.prompt:
Please translate each line literally into English.
103 Non però qui si pente, ma si ride, 104 non de la colpa, ch’a mente non torna, 105 ma del valor ch’ordinò e provide.
query.result: 103 Not here does one repent, but laughs, 104 not of the fault, which does not return to mind, 105 but of the virtue that ordered and provided.

query.prompt:
Please translate each line literally into English.
106 Qui si rimira ne l’arte ch’addorna 107 cotanto affetto, e discernesi ’l bene 108 per che ’l mondo di sù quel di giù torna.
query.result: 106 Here is mirrored in the art that adorns 107 so much affection, and the good is discerned 108 for which the world from above returns to below.

query.prompt:
Please translate each line literally into English.
109 Ma perché tutte le tue voglie piene 110 ten porti che son nate in questa spera, 111 proceder ancor oltre mi convene.
query.result: 109 But because all your desires full 110 you carry that are born in this sphere, 111 to proceed further I must.

query.prompt:
Please translate each line literally into English.
112 Tu vuo’ saper chi è in questa lumera 113 che qui appresso me così scintilla 114 come raggio di sole in acqua mera.
query.result: 112 You want to know who is in this light 113 that here near me so sparkles 114 as a ray of sun in clear water.

query.prompt:
Please translate each line literally into English.
115 Or sappi che là entro si tranquilla 116 Raab; e a nostr’ ordine congiunta, 117 di lei nel sommo grado si sigilla.
query.result: 115 Now know that there within is tranquil 116 Raab; and joined to our order, 117 of her in the highest degree it is sealed.

query.prompt:
Please translate each line literally into English.
118 Da questo cielo, in cui l’ombra s’appunta 119 che ’l vostro mondo face, pria ch’altr’ alma 120 del trïunfo di Cristo fu assunta.
query.result: 118 From this heaven, in which the shadow points 119 that your world made, before another soul 120 of the triumph of Christ was assumed.

query.prompt:
Please translate each line literally into English.
121 Ben si convenne lei lasciar per palma 122 in alcun cielo de l’alta vittoria 123 che s’acquistò con l’una e l’altra palma,
124 perch’ ella favorò la prima gloria 125 di Iosüè in su la Terra Santa, 126 che poco tocca al papa la memoria.
query.result:
121 Well it was fitting to leave her for palm 122 in some heaven of the high victory 123 that was acquired with the one and the other palm,
124 because she favored the first glory 125 of Joshua on the Holy Land, 126 that little touches the pope’s memory.

query.prompt:
Please translate each line literally into English.
127 La tua città, che di colui è pianta 128 che pria volse le spalle al suo fattore 129 e di cui è la ’nvidia tanto pianta,
130 produce e spande il maladetto fiore 131 c’ha disvïate le pecore e li agni, 132 però che fatto ha lupo del pastore.
query.result:
127 Your city, that of him is planting 128 that first turned his back on his maker 129 and of whom is the envy so planted,
130 produces and spreads the accursed flower 131 that has diverted the sheep and lambs, 132 because it has made a wolf of the shepherd.

query.prompt:
Please translate each line literally into English.
133 Per questo l’Evangelio e i dottor magni 134 son derelitti, e solo ai Decretali 135 si studia, sì che pare a’ lor vivagni.
query.result: 133 For this the Gospel and the great doctors 134 are abandoned, and only to the Decretals 135 one studies, so that it seems to their lackeys.

query.prompt:
Please translate each line literally into English.
136 A questo intende il papa e ’ cardinali; 137 non vanno i lor pensieri a Nazarette, 138 là dove Gabrïello aperse l’ali.

142 tosto libere fien de l’avoltero».
query.result:
139 But Vatican and the other chosen parts 140 of Rome that have been cemetery 141 to the militia that followed Peter,
142 soon free they will be from the vulture.
